41:Sensor Rest|42:Sensor Motion|11:Ignition Off Rest|12:Ignition On Motion|21:Ignition On Rest|22:Ignition On Motion|1A:Fake Tow|16:Tow|

menu2.name: BSI (Bearer Settings Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBSI is used to configure the parameters for GSM/GPRS/LTE Cat4/WCDMA data connection.

menu3.Description: Access Point Name
The user name of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
The password of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
Backup access point name
The user name of backup APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
The password of backup APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Auto (LTE & WCDMA & GSM)|1: GSM Only|2: WCDMA Only|3: LTE Only|4: GSM&WCDMA (GSM First)|5: WCDMA&GSM (WCDMA First|6: WCDMA & LTE & GSM (WCDMA First)
menu3.Description: Note: “GSM” means EGPRS here.

menu2.name: SRI (Backend Server Registration Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSRI is used to configure how to report all the messages, including the server information and the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal. If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9:MQTT mode|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority|2: High priority |
menu3.Description: If the buffer report function is enabled and the device goes into areas without network coverage, it will store all reports locally. If the device goes into areas with network coverage again, it will then send all the buffered reports.
The IP address or the domain name of the main server.
The port number of the main server.
The IP address or the domain name of the backup server.
The port number of the backup server.
The interval of sending heartbeat package message which makes EGPRS connection alive.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK message when receiving a message from the terminal.
This defines the format of the report message sent from the device to the backend server.
This parameter defines whether to reply with the ACK confirmation via SMS when the command is sent via SMS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: AES-256 includes IMEI|2: AES-256 not include IMEI and uses report header +ARSP/+ABUF.
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the message encryption method.

menu2.name: QSS (Quick Start Settings)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTQSS is used to configure GPRS and backend server parameters if the length of all the settings is less than 160 bytes. Otherwise, the two commands AT+GTBSI and AT+GTSRI are used to set those parameters.

menu3.Description: Access Point Name
The user name of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
The password of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9:MQTT mode|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority |2: High priority|
menu3.Description: If the buffer report function is enabled and the device goes into areas without network coverage, it will store all reports locally. If the device goes into areas with network coverage again, it will then send all the buffered reports.
The IP address or the domain name of the main server.
The port number of the main server.
The IP address or the domain name of the backup backend server.
The port number of the backup server.
The interval of sending heartbeat package message which makes EGPRS connection alive.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK message when receiving a message from the terminal.
This defines the format of the report message sent from the device to the backend server.
This parameter defines whether to reply with the ACK confirmation via SMS when the command is sent via SMS.

menu2.name: MQT ( MQTT Server Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMQT is used to configure the username and password to connect to the MQTT server and to subscribe to topics and publish topics, If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the MQTT server.

menu3.Description: It is used to set keep alive mechanism for MQTT. It is a time interval measured in minutes. In particular, 0 means the keep alive mechanism is disabled.
If the mqtt server uses authentication, the user name is specified here.
If the MQTT server uses authentication, the password is specified here.
The client subscribes to topic name.
The client publishes topic name.
Each client connecting to the server has a unique client identifier (ClientID).

menu2.name: OWL (Operator List Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWL is used to configure a white or forbidden list of operators to allow GPRS connection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: White list Mode|2: Black List Mode|
100: Number|6|||

menu3.Description: A white list of PLMN codes for network operators. The PLMN code comprises of mobile country code MCC and mobile network code MNC, each of which consists of 3 digits. The last digit of MNC can be omitted, for example, 46001F or 46001 represents the PLMN of CHINA UNICOM.
The timeout period for the terminal to establish connection to the TCP server.

menu2.name: FTP (FTP Server)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFTP is used to configure the FTP server information as to where and how to upload data packets. If the device is configured correctly and <Server Type> of AT+GTCMS is set to 1, it will be able to transfer data packets to FTP server.

menu3.Description: The IP address or the domain name of the FTP server.
The server port of the FTP server.
The file path to save pictures. To restore the default path after a path is set, set it to “\”.
The user name to login the FTP server.
The password to login the FTP server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Passive mode.|1: Active mode.|
menu3.Description: The mode of transferring file.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Breakpoint Continuation Mode|1: Retransmission Mode|
menu3.Description: The mode of transferring picture after transfer fails.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Whether to report +RESP:GTFTP to the backend server after transferring a file.
The file name prefix of transformed file. It should not include “.”.

menu2.name: TLS (TLS Data Encryption)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTLS is used to configure TLS encryption parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The Data Server of SRI|
menu3.Description: The index of the Server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Specify whether the terminal enables the TLS function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not verify the certificates|1: Only server certification|2: Two-way certification
menu3.Description: It specifies the certificate verification method for the terminal.

menu2.name: CFG (Global Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCFG command is used to configure global parameters.

menu3.Description: It is set to change the current password.
An ASCII string which represents the name of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the odograph by GNSS|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable to calculate the total mileage.
The initial value for calculating the total mileage.

menu3.RangeMx: Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Mileage|Send Time|Device Name|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of report messages, especially the composition of GNSS information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: GNSS Deep Saving Mode|2: GNSS Low Saving Mode|
menu3.Description: Enable or disable power saving mode, which is used to save power consumption of an external power or internal device battery.

menu3.RangeMx: GNSS Satellite Number|
menu3.Description: A bitwise numeral to control whether to include the corresponding fields in each position after <Cell ID>.
Bitwise mask to configure which event message should be sent to the backend server.
It configures the working mode of PIN on the connector.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Each time the device powers on, all LEDs will work for 30 minutes and then be off.|1: All LEDs will be turned on as configured|
menu3.Description: It configures the working mode of the LED lights.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the device information report (+RESP:GTINF).
The interval for reporting the device information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Ignore SMS location request.|1: Report the current position to server.|2: Report the Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|&0: Hang up only.|1: Report the current position to server.|2: Report the Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|3: Both 1 And 2|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask for SMS. 4 high bits for SMS request. Each bit represents one kind of report. Set it to 1 to enable the corresponding report, and set it to 0 to disable.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Charge On Need|1: Charge After Ignition On|
menu3.Description: It controls the charge mode of the backup battery.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: AGPS Offline|2: AGPS Online|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates whether to enable AGPS. AGPS helps increase the chances of getting GNSS position successfully and reduces the time needed to get GNSS position.

menu3.RangeMx: 00: Do not allow the cell information report.|40: Allow the cell information report after failing to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|80: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM after getting GNSS position successfully every time if cell information is available.|C0: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM no matter whether it is successful to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|&+RESP:GTRTL|+RESP:GTLBC|+RESP:GTFRI / +RESP:GTERI|+RESP:GTSOS|+RESP:GTTOW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
menu3.Description: A hexadecimal numeral to indicate how to report cell information.
A time parameter to monitor the GNSS signal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: GPS and GLONASS|1: GPS|4: GPS and BeiDou|10:GPS, GLONASS and Galieo positioning systems. |11:GPS, GLONASS and BeiDou|12:GPS, Galieo and BeiDou|
menu3.Description: The working mode of GNSS chip.
A time parameter to set the time for GNSS on.

menu2.name: DOG (Protocol Watchdog)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOG command is used to reboot the device in a time based manner or upon ignition. This helps the device avoid working in an abnormal state for a long time. Besides these two automatic reboot methods, the device also supports the use of the digital input to trigger the reboot manually.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Reboot Periodically|2: Ignition Reboot|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the watchdog function.
If the time interval between two adjacent ignition on events is greater than this value, the device will automatically reboot when ignition on.
The interval which is in the unit of day to reboot unit in day.
The time clock to perform the reboot operation after 'Interval' is met.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Whether to report the +RESP:GTDOG message before reboot.
ID of the digital input port which is used to trigger the manually reboot in despite of working mode.
The interval for rebooting the device when there is no network signal. 0 means “Do not reboot the device”.
The interval for rebooting the device when the device is unable to be registered to the EGPRS/LTE network. 0 means “Do not reboot the device.”
The length of time (in minutes) before rebooting the device when the device fails to send a message. 0 means “Do not reboot the device”.
This parameter is used to set the interval for detecting whether the device works properly. If the device is abnormal and the interval is longer than the specified interval, the device will reboot.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Reboot System|1: Reboot RF Module|
menu3.Description: It is used to set the category that needs to be rebooted.
The time interval in minutes for rebooting the device when the device cannot receive CANBUS messages from CAN100

When Reboot periodically time reached, the device will reboot at a random moment between <Time> and <Time> + <Random Reboot Time>. 0 means not use <Random Reboot Time>. effective only when is set to 1.

menu2.name: GAM (GNSS-Assisted Motion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGAM is used for assisting in measuring motion with GNSS if the sensor detects stationary state while the vehicle is ignition on.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the GNSS-assisted motion measurement function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the use of GNSS speed to assist with motion status measurement based on motion sensor state.
The speed threshold which is combined with GNSS speed to measure the status of movement.
If the average speed is higher than <Motion Speed Threshold> for <Motion Cumulative Time>, the device is considered to be in moving state.
If the average speed is lower than <Motion Speed Threshold> for <Motionless Cumulative Time>, the device is considered to be in stationary state.
If the time of GNSS fix is more than <GNSS Fix Failure Timeout>, the device will update motion status by motion sensor.

menu2.name: HMC (Hour Meter Count)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHMC is used to measure the accumulated use time of the device with each actuation of ignition on. To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable
menu3.Description: Enable/Disable the hour meter count function. If the hour meter count function is enabled, the hour meter count will be increased when the device detects the vehicle ignition is turned on.

menu2.name: HRM (Hex Report Mask)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTHRM command is used to control the composition of the corresponding HEX report message. In each HEX report message, the corresponding mask for the report indicates which part is reported.

menu3.RangeMx: Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|Reserved
menu3.Description: Component mask of the acknowledgement received.

menu3.RangeMx: Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Analog Input Mode|Analog Input1 Voltage|Analog Input2 Voltage|Reserved|Digital IO Status|Motion Status|GNSS Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|RFID|CAN Data|EIO100 IO Status|RFID Length|Reserved|Reserved|Analog Input3 Voltage|Reserved
menu3.Description: Component mask of the location report message.

menu3.RangeMx: |Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Analog Input Mode|Analog Input1 Voltage|Analog Input2 Voltage|Reserved|Digital IO Status|Motion Status|GNSS Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|RFID|CAN Data|EIO100 IO Status|RFID Length|Reserved|Reserved|Analog Input3 Voltage|Reserved
menu3.Description: Component mask of the event report message.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number|INF Expansion Mask|+RESP:GTVER|+RESP:GTIOS|+RESP:GTGPS|+RESP:GTBAT|+RESP:GTCID|+RESP:GTCSQ|+RESP:GTTMZ|+RESP:GTGSM
menu3.Description: Component mask of the information report message

menu3.RangeMx: +RESP:GTGSV|+RESP:GTUVN|+RESP:GTCVN|+RESP:GTCSN|+RESP:GTAUI|Reserved|+RESP:GTCML|Reserved|+RESP:GTWRT|+RESP:GTBTI|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTSCS|+RESP:GTCIF|+RESP:GTRSV|INF Expansion2 Mask|
menu3.Description: Component mask of the information report message.

menu3.RangeMx: Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTBSV|Reserved|Network Type|+RESP:GTASV|
|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|UID
menu3.Description: Component mask of the heartbeat data.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|
menu3.Description: Component mask of the crash data packet.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number
menu3.Description: Component mask of the crash data packet.

menu3.RangeMx: |Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version
menu3.Description: Component mask of the CANBUS Information packet.

menu2.name: OWH (Outside Working Hours)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWH is used to define the working hours and the working mode to protect the privacy.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Manual Start Mode|2: Full Manual Mode|3: Automatic Mode|
menu3.Description: Working mode
Bitwise mask to specify the working days in a week.

menu2.name: PDS (Preserving Device's States)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPDS is used to preserve specified logic states for the device. The function works according to the <Mode> setting, and the logic state(s) to be saved are selected according to the value of <Mask>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Save Logical States|2: Reset Logical States|
menu3.Description: The working mode of preserving special logic state of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: States of GEO|1: Reserved|2: State of GNSS antenna|3: Information of last known position|4: State of ignition|5: State of wave shape 1|6: State of digital input|7: State of SPD|8: State of SSR|9: State of main power|10: State of PEO|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure which device states will be preserved. Each bit represents a state.

menu2.name: PIN (Auto-unlock PIN)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPIN is used to configure the auto-unlock PIN function of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Set it to 1 to enable the auto-unlock PIN function, and set it to 0 to disable this function.
The code used to unlock the SIM PIN.

menu2.name: TMA (Time Adjustment)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTMA is used to adjust for the local time of the device remotely. Upon receiving this command, the device will set the time zone and daylight saving accordingly. Then it will use the given UTC time to adjust for the local time based on the time zone and daylight saving setting.

menu3.Description: It indicates the positive or negative offset of the local time from UTC time.
UTC offset in hours.
UTC offset in minutes.
Enable/disable daylight saving time.
UTC time used to adjust local time.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Only correct device time when device can't get GNSS UTC time|1: Always correct device time with network time|2: Never use network time to correct device time
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to check GNSS UTC time with network time.

menu2.name: WLT (Allowlist)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTWLT is used to configure a list of authorized phone numbers which are allowed to perform the SMS functions.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0: White list for location by call.|Bit1: White list for voice monitoring.|Bit2: White list for SMS.|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the working mode.

A list of comma-separated phone numbers to be updated to the white list. The total number of the phone numbers is determined by <Start Index> and <End Index>. The format of the phone numbers includes area code and phone number. The area code is optional.

menu2.name: AVS (Accelerometer Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAVS is used to configure parameters for detecting virtual ignition status based on motion status. It works when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Accelerometer (motion status) virtual ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: A time parameter to determine whether the device enters stationary state. The device will be considered in stationary state after the motion sensor detects stationary state and the stationary state is maintained for the period of time specified by the parameter <Rest Validity>.

A time parameter to determine whether the device enters moving state. The device will be considered in moving state after the motion sensor detects movement and the moving state is maintained for the period of time specified by the parameter <Movement Validity>.

menu2.name: VVS (Voltage Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVVS is used to configure parameters for checking ignition state by voltage. It will work when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Voltage Virtual Ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: The external power voltage in ignition on state. Different vehicles have different voltage in ignition on state. This parameter should be set very close to the original external power so that the device can detect ignition event more accurately.
The offset from <Ignition On Voltage> used to determine ignition on or ignition off state.
The debounce time before updating virtual ignition state according to the external power voltage.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable smart voltage adjustment algorithm.
The debounce time to wait before updating the virtual ignition off state according to the external power voltage.

menu2.name: VMS (Virtual Ignition Mode Selection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVMS is used to configure the mode of virtual ignition state detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|2: Voltage virtual ignition detection mode. |4: Accelerometer virtual ignition detection mode|7: Combined detection mode. |
menu3.Description: A numeral to define the working mode of virtual ignition state detection.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to detect the ignition on event.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to detect ignition off event.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: AND logic.|1: OR logic.|
menu3.Description: The logic of each bit in <Virtual Ignition On Mask>.

menu2.name: CMD (Command String Storage)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCMD command is used to store the commands which will be used by the command AT+GTUDF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete command.|1: Add command.|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the store command string.
A numeric to identify the stored command.
The whole content of the stored command.

menu2.name: UDF (User Defined Function)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUDF command is used to bind input events and stored commands. The input events will trigger the corresponding stored commands.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable The Event Group.|1: Enable The Event Group|2: Delete The Event Group|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the user defined fuction.
A numeric to identify the group of input events and stored commands to execute.

menu3.RangeMx: Power on finished|Ignition on|Ignition off|Attached to the GPRS network|Not attached to the GPRS network|Registered on GSM network|Not registered on GSM network|Network roaming|Network non-roaming|SIM card is locked|GNSS is on|GNSS is off|The device is stationary|The device is moving|External charge inserted|No external charge|The device is charging|The device is not charging|Digital input 2 is activated|Digital input 2 is inactivated|Digital input 1 is activated|Digital input 1 is inactivated|SIM card is inserted|SIM card is not inserted|GNSS external antenna is inserted|GNSS external antenna is not inserted|Inside the speed range|Outside the speed range|Messages need to be sent|No messages need to be sent|Digital input 3 is activated|Digital input 3 is inactivated|Backup battery inserted|No backup battery|No change of SIM card|SIM card change|Network jamming is detected|Network jamming is not detected|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|The device fixes GNSS successfully|The device fails to fix GNSS|Reserved|Reserved|The ID is authorized|The ID is unauthorized|Output1 is activated|Output1 is inactivated|Output2 is activated|Output2 is inactivated|Output3 is activated|Output3 is inactivated
menu3.Description: The bitwise mask to indicate the input events included in the group.
The debounce time for input events before the specified stored commands are executed.

menu3.RangeMx: Inside the Geo 0|Inside the Geo 1|Inside the Geo 2|Inside the Geo 3|Inside the Geo 4|Inside the Geo 5|Inside the Geo 6|Inside the Geo 7|Inside the Geo 8|Inside the Geo 9|Inside the Geo 10|Inside the Geo 11|Inside the Geo 12|Inside the Geo 13|Inside the Geo 14|Inside the Geo 15|Inside the Geo 16|Inside the Geo 17|Inside the Geo 18|Inside the Geo 19|
menu3.Description: The bitwise mask to indicate the input events within the GEO.

menu3.RangeMx: Outside the Geo 0|Outside the Geo 1|Outside the Geo 2|Outside the Geo 3|Outside the Geo 4|Outside the Geo 5|Outside the Geo 6|Outside the Geo 7|Outside the Geo 8|Outside the Geo 9|Outside the Geo 10|Outside the Geo 11|Outside the Geo 12|Outside the Geo 13|Outside the Geo 14|Outside the Geo 15|Outside the Geo 16|Outside the Geo 17|Outside the Geo 18|Outside the Geo 19|
menu3.Description: The bitwise mask to indicate the input events outside the GEO.

menu3.RangeMx: Stocmd ID Mask 0|Stocmd ID Mask 1|Stocmd ID Mask 2|Stocmd ID Mask 3|Stocmd ID Mask 4|Stocmd ID Mask 5|Stocmd ID Mask 6|Stocmd ID Mask 7|Stocmd ID Mask 8|Stocmd ID Mask 9|Stocmd ID Mask 10|Stocmd ID Mask 11|Stocmd ID Mask 12|Stocmd ID Mask 13|Stocmd ID Mask 14|Stocmd ID Mask 15|Stocmd ID Mask 16|Stocmd ID Mask 17|Stocmd ID Mask 18|Stocmd ID Mask 19|Stocmd ID Mask 20|Stocmd ID Mask 21|Stocmd ID Mask 22|Stocmd ID Mask 23|Stocmd ID Mask 24|Stocmd ID Mask 25|Stocmd ID Mask 26|Stocmd ID Mask 27|Stocmd ID Mask 28|Stocmd ID Mask 29|Stocmd ID Mask 30|Stocmd ID Mask 31|
menu3.Description: Note: The maximum number of the stored commands to be excuted in a group is five.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeric to indicate whether to return acknowledgement message after the stored commands are executed

menu3.RangeMx: Inside the Peo 0|Inside the Peo 1|Inside the Peo 2|Inside the Peo 3|Inside the Peo 4|Inside the Peo 5|Inside the Peo 6|Inside the Peo 7|Inside the Peo 8|Inside the Peo 9|Inside the Peo 10|Inside the Peo 11|Inside the Peo 12|Inside the Peo 13|Inside the Peo 14|Inside the Peo 15|Inside the Peo 16|Inside the Peo 17|Inside the Peo 18|Inside the Peo 19|

Outside the Peo 0|Outside the Peo 1|Outside the Peo 2|Outside the Peo 3|Outside the Peo 4|Outside the Peo 5|Outside the Peo 6|Outside the Peo 7|Outside the Peo 8|Outside the Peo 9|Outside the Peo 10|Outside the Peo 11|Outside the Peo 12|Outside the Peo 13|Outside the Peo 14|Outside the Peo 15|Outside the Peo 16|Outside the Peo 17|Outside the Peo 18|Outside the Peo 19|

menu2.name: GNA(GNSS Assistance)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGNA is used to configure GNSS assistance data download and update.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|

menu2.name: ASC (Axis Self-Calibration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTASC is used to define the condition for calibrating the directions of accelerometer. When the auto self-calibration factors updated, the device will report the event message ASC which includes the calibration result to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the +RESP:GTASC report.

menu2.name: BTS (Bluetooth Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBTS is used to configure Bluetooth settings for the device to report certain events.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Working mode of the Bluetooth.
The name of the device for Bluetooth identification. The “%IMEI” in the Bluetooth broadcast name is replaced with “_” and IMEI number.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Non-discoverable mode|1: General Discoverable After Igintion On|2:General Discoverable After Igintion Off|3:General Discoverable After Power On|
menu3.Description: The mode to configure the Bluetooth to be non-discoverable or discoverable for the period according to (Discoverable Time).
Time period for the device to remain discoverable.

menu3.RangeMx: Bluetooth Name|Bluetooth MAC Address|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Peer Role|Reserved|Peer Address Type|Peer MAC Address|Peer Name|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of Bluetooth information in report messages.
Bitwise mask to configure which event report should be sent to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No PIN code is needed|1: PIN code is needed for pairing|
menu3.Description: It defines whether a PIN code for pairing is needed or not.
PIN code for pairing if needed.

menu2.name: BAS (Bluetooth Accessory)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBAS is used for the device to scan or connect with Bluetooth accessories in order to obtain data such as humidity, temperature or fuel level. To use this command, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be enabled.

menu3.Description: Index of the Bluetooth accessory.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No Bluetooth accessory|1: Escort Bluetooth Accessory|2: Beacon temperature sensor|4: CAN accessory|6: Beacon Multi-Functional Sensorr|7: Technoton accessory|8: External Input Output Bluetooth Accessory|10: Mechatronics Bluetooth accessory|11: Magnet Bluetooth accessory|12: BLE TPMS sensor|13: Relay Bluetooth accessory|
menu3.Description: The type of the Bluetooth accessory which is selected in the Index.
The model of the Bluetooth accessory which is selected in the<Accessory Type>.

menu3.RangeMx: Accessory Name|Accessory MAC|Accessory Status|Accessory Battery Level|Accessory Temperature|Accessory Humidity|Reserved|Accessory Input Output Data|Accessory Event Notification Data|Tire pressure|Timestamp|Enhanced Temperature|Magnet Data|Accessory Battery Percentage|Relay Data|

menu3.Description: The interval for reading data from Bluetooth accessory.
Specify the lower limit voltage. When the voltage of Bluetooth accessary is below this value, the device will report message +RESP:GTBAA to backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable event notification.|1: Enable event notification.|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable event notification function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: The working mode of the temperature alarm.
If the sensor detects the environment temperature which meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature.
The device will report temperature alarm every this times of temperature reading.
the code needs to be input when paired with accessories.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
0: Disable.|1: Report humidity alarm within the humidity range.|2: Report humidity alarm outside the humidity range.|3: Report humidity alarm only onceenters or exits the humidity range. |

menu3.Description: The actual length of sensor after cutting.
The frequency of empty sensor (not immersed in fuel).
The frequency of sensor fully immersed in fuel.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The original value of fuel level.|1: The percentage of fuel level.|
menu3.Description: The format of fuel level in the message.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable event notification function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report tire pressure alarm within the tire pressure range.|2: Report tire pressure alarm outside the tire pressure range.|3: Report tire pressure alarm only once enters/exits the tire pressure range. |
menu3.Description: The working mode of the tire pressure alarm.
If the tire pressure keeps meeting the alarm condition for <Validity> times, the tire pressure alarm will be triggered.
If the device do not detect the tire pressure sensor in the<Available Validity Time>, the <Accessory Status> in the message +RESP:GTERI report messages will be 0.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable event notification function.
It is the current password for the accessory device.
It is set to change the current password.

menu2.name: BID (Bluetooth Beacon ID)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBID is used for the device to scan Bluetooth beacon accessories. To use this function, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be 1.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable this function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: WKF300|1: iBeacon E6|2: ID ELA|4: WID310|
Reserved|Accessory MAC|Reserved|Accessory Battery Level|Reserved|Reserved|Signal Strength|Beacon Type and Beacon Data|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the Bluetooth accessory information in +RESP:GTBAA and +RESP:GTBID.
It specifies the lower voltage limit.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:No push the WKF300|1:Push the WKF300|
menu3.Description: If it is set to 1, WKF300 is pushed, the device will report +RESP:GTBAA.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Allow the device to scan only once. |2: After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning Keyfobs continuously.|

menu3.Description: The device scans Keyfobs for the time period specified by this parameter

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Allow the device to scan only once.|2: Allow the device to scan continuously. |
0: Disable alarm.|1: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast.|2: Alarm when Bluetooth broadcast is not received.|3: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast or leaving Bluetooth broadcast.|
0: Disable.|1: Allow the device to scan only once.|2: After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning IDELA continuously.|3: Allow the device to scan continuously.|
0: Disable.|2: After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID310 continuously. |3: Allow the device to scan continuously. |

menu3.Description: It is the first three bytes of Bluetooth address, which is composed of NAP and UAP.

menu2.name: SVR (Stolen Vehicle Recovery)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSVR is used to configure the Bluetooth settings for the Primary device. If the Primary device does not successfully communicate with the Ghost device within the time defined by <Connect Interval> * <Connect Fail Count>, it will report the message +RESP:GTSVR to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: Note: If <Mode> in AT+GTSVR is set to 1, the broadcast service for AT+GTBTS will not work.
The maximum amount of time allowed for the Ghost device to establish a connection with the Primary device. Unit: minute.
The maximum number of connection failures between the Primary device and the Ghost device.
The IMEI of the Ghost device which is used to match with the Primary device.
It specifies the interval of +RESP:GTBTI regarding the status and information of the Ghost device. 0 means 'Disable the +RESP:GTBTI report'. Unit: minute.

menu2.name: FRI (Fixed Report Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFRI is used to configure the parameters for fixed report FRI or ERI.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable.|1:Fixed Time Report.|2:Fixed Distance Report. |3:Fixed Mileage Report. |4:Optimum Report.|5:Fixed Time or Mileage Report.|99:Real Time Report. |
menu3.Description: The working mode of fixed report.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Enable report.|1: Disable report.
menu3.Description: Disable/enable reporting when there is no GPS fixing
Enable/disable reporting within the time range specified by Start Time and End Time.
The interval time to update GNSS position.
Timed cycle to send report to the backend server.
The threshold to determine whether unit is turning around a corner.

menu3.RangeMx: Digital Fuel Sensor Data|1-Wire Data|CAN Data|Percentage|Volume|Reserved|Reserved|RF433 Accessory Data|Bluetooth Accessory Data|Reserved|Fuel Temperature|
menu3.Description: Used to configure whether to report the data from peripherals by +RESP:GTERI.

menu2.name: FFC (Frequency Change of FRI)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFFC is used to change the parameters of fixed report when a certain event occurs, so that different report interval requirements can be met. When the event disappears, the device will resume its previous settings.

menu3.Description: Priority to the event which triggers the parameter change for fixed report. 0 is the highest priority.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Change FRI parameters By Geo-Fence Alarm|2: Change FRI parameters By Know Roaming Alarm|3: Change FRI parameters By Unknow Roaming Alarm|
menu3.Description: Specify the trigger event to change the fixed report parameters

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Fixed Distance Report|3: Fixed Mileage Report|4: Optimum Report|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report|
menu3.Description: When the specified event occurs, the fixed report mode will be changed according to this parameter.

menu2.name: CRA (Crash Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCRA is used to configure the parameters for crash detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Detection Of Crash With Three-Axis|2: Enable Detection Of Crash With Self-calibration Three-Axis|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the crash detection function.

The acceleration threshold for crash in X direction. The smaller the parameter, the easier it is to detect crash events. If <Threshold_X> is 0, the device will not monitor crash event in X-axis. The unit is 0.1g.

The acceleration threshold for crash in Y direction. The smaller the parameter, the easier it is to detect crash events. If <Threshold_Y> is 0, the device will not monitor crash event in Y-axis. The unit is 0.1g.

The acceleration threshold for crash in Z direction. The smaller the parameter, the easier it is to detect crash events. If <Threshold_Z> is 0, the device will not monitor crash event in Z-axis. The unit is 0.1g.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Start Sampling After power on|1: Start Sampling After ignition on|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate when to start sampling acceleration data.
The number of recorded XYZ-axis acceleration samples before crash.
The number of recorded XYZ-axis acceleration samples after crash.
A numeral which indicates whether to report the acceleration data to the backend server.
A numeral which indicates whether to report the GNSS information of 10s before crash and 10s after crash to the backend server.
The time during which GNSS information is recorded before crash.
The time during which GNSS information is recorded after crash.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable the report.|1: Enable the report.|
menu3.Description: Whether to report +RESP:GTCRE to the backend server.

menu2.name: BZA (Buzzer Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set buzzer alarm. There are four kinds of alarms. Each alarm outputs a different sound with the buzzer, and all the alarms are settable in this command. Before those alarms are used, the output ID which connects with the buzzer should be configured and enabled.

menu2.name: SPA (Overspeed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set the speed thresholds and bind one alarm type with each speed threshold for the buzzer alarm. If the current speed meets one of the thresholds, the buzzer will make a sound corresponding to the alarm type.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Strict Standard Mode|2: Warning mode|

menu2.name: GEO (Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGEO is used to configure the parameters of circular Geo-Fence. Circular Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated. .

menu3.Description: The ID of the circular Geo-Fence.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: The working mode for the device to report the Geo-Fence message GIN or GOT to the backend server.
The interval of GPS checking for the Geo-Fence alarm.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|21: Auto Mode|22: Manual Mode|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the trigger mode of the Geo-Fence function.
Whether to report +RESP:GTGES when the specified trigger mode is triggered.
Start to monitor the device that enters the geo-fence.
End monitoring the device that enters the geo-fence.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Ignore State Change|1: Need State Change|
menu3.Description: The mode of reporting the device’s Geo state.

menu2.name: PEO (Polygon Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPEO is used to configure the parameters of Polygon Geo-Fence. Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo-fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated.

menu3.Description: The ID of the polygon Geo-Fence.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: The working mode for the device to report the polygon Geo-Fence message to the backend server.
The interval of GPS checking for the Geo-Fence alarm.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Report when getting the PEO state for the first time.|1: Do not report until the PEO state changes.
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the mode of reporting PEO state.

menu2.name: PEG (Polygon Geo-Fence Group)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPEG is used to configure the groups of Polygon Geo-Fence.

menu3.Description: ID of GEO group.
The working mode for polygon Geo-Fence in this group.
The ID range of the GEO ID indicates which ID is currently in the group.
The ID range of the GEO ID indicates which ID is currently in the group.
The minimum value that triggers the speed alarm when the device inside the Geo Fence that belongs to this group.
If the speed over the speed threshold and is maintained for a period of time longer than the <Validity> time, the speed alarm will be triggered.

menu2.name: HBM (Harsh Behavior Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHBM is used to monitor the harsh driving behavior based on GNSS or motion sensor.The same harsh behavior within 30 seconds will only be reported once if only GNSS is used to measure harsh driving behavior.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Detected by GNSS only|2: Detected by motion sensor only|3: Detected by motion sensor or GNSS|4: Detected by motion sensor and GNSS|5: Detected by XYZ-axis acceleration data only|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the harsh behavior monitoring function
The speed changes within Behavior Duration.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Discard Unknow Alarm|1: Discard Unknow Alarm|

menu3.Description: If the last known speed of unit read from GNSS is greater or equal to <High Speed>, the vehicle that the terminal is attached to is considered to be high speed.
The threshold for harsh braking in high speed level.
The threshold for harsh acceleration in high speed level.
If the last known speed is less than <High Speed> while greater or equal to <Medium Speed>, the vehicle is considered to be medium speed.
The threshold for harsh braking in medium speed level.
The threshold for harsh acceleration in medium speed level.
The threshold for harsh braking in low speed level.
The threshold for harsh acceleration in low speed level.
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is in harsh turn or harsh break status.
The time parameter to confirm that the device enters harsh turn or harsh break status.
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is in harsh accelerate behavior status
The time parameter to confirm that the device enters harsh accelerate status.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Only Report HBM Alarm|1: Report HBE and HBM Alarm|2: Only Report HBE Alarm|

menu2.name: IDL (Excessive Idling Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDL is used to detect the engine excessive idling (vehicle stays stationary while ignition is on). To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device. If the vehicle is entering into/leaves the idle status, the device will report the event message IDN/IDF to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: If the vehicle is detected to be stationary with ignition on for this time long, it is considered to be in idling status.
The time of the vehicle is considered to leave idling status.

menu2.name: JBS (Jamming Behavior Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJBS is used for the Jamming Behavior.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Jamming Behavior Setting Configure Mode.|2: Jamming Behavior Setting Reset Mode.

menu3.Description: Whether to check speed when the device enters into jamming state.
The speed limit to cut off fuel.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Disable motion sensor.|1: Enable motion sensor.|
menu3.Description: The GNSS fixed fail is timeout, whether need judge motion sensor state to cut fuel.
It defines whether to control siren with the digital output 2 in the current JBS state.
If the device enters into JBS and then cuts off fuel, it will check the current jamming state when the Fuel Cut-off Timer T3 condition is met.
It expresses whether the JBS state machine starts T3 timer to check jamming state and starts T6 timer if the device quits jamming state.
It indicates the length of time to be waited before releasing fuel and quitting JBS state machine.
It indicates the length of time the siren alarm sounds.
It indicates the length of time for preparing for alarm.

menu2.name: JDC (Jamming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJDC is used to configure the parameters for jamming detection. When the detection condition is matched, the device will report the event message JDR/JDS to the backend server according to the <Mode> setting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report the +RESP:GTJDR message upon entering into jamming state.|2: Report the +RESP:GTJDS messageupon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state.|

menu3.Description: The smaller the value, the more sensitive the detection will be.
The smaller the value, the more sensitive the detection will be.
when the device detects the jamming, the device based on this parameter to trigger the enter Jamming event.
when the device quits the jamming, the device based on this parameter to trigger the quit Jamming event.

menu2.name: MON (Voice Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMON is used to configure the parameters for stealth voice monitoring. It supports both outgoing call and incoming call. If this functions is triggered, the device will send the message MON to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0 :Disable|1:Only Make The Stealth Call|2:Only Answer Incoming Stealth Call|3:Both Mode 1 And 2|

menu3.Description: Set the volume of the microphone, 0 means disable microphone.
Set the volume of the speaker, 0 means disable speaker.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable Send Alarm|1: Enable Send Alarm|2:Only Send Alarm through SMS|
menu3.Description: Specify the sending method of the monitoring alarm.
This parameter defines the number of rings before answering an incoming call automatically.

menu2.name: RMD (Roaming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRMD is used to configure the parameters for roaming detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: SIM (Binding SIM Card)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTSIM command is used to bind SIM card function. If the current SIM card is replaced by another SIM card, then the digital output will be triggered.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Bind the current SIM card.|2: Bind the specified SIM card by ICCID.|

menu2.name: SOS (SOS Setting)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure a specified input port for emergency. When an emergency occurs, the end user can use the specified input port to trigger the emergency call and report the position message SOS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: SOS call only.|2: Only Send The Current Position to the backend|3: Send the current position to the backend server first and then make SOS call(s).|4: Send SOS to the SMS gateway via SMS and make SOS call|

menu3.Description: Set the volume of the microphone, 0 means disable microphone.
Set the volume of the speaker, 0 means disable speaker.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Send The Current GNSS Location|2: Send The Last GNSS Location|3: Both Mode 1 And 2|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the type of the GNSS position.

menu2.name: SPD (Speed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a speed range for the speed alarm function of the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal could report the message SPD to the backend server when its moving speed is outside or inside the range.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Alarm in speed range|2: Alarm out of speed range|3: Report Speed Alarm Only once|4: Report Speed Alarm when current speed changed|

menu3.Description: A period of time that the speed meets and maintains in the alarm condition.
The interval of sending speed alarm message if unit maintains in the alarm condition.
It indicates the type of speed alarm. The Report ID is reported via the +RESP:GTSPD message.

menu3.RangeMx: Overspeed Status|Pre-speed State Duration Time|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the +RESP:GTSPD message.

menu2.name: SSR (Start/Stop Report)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSSR is used to detect the status of vehicle (Start/Stop status). When it is detected by the device that the vehicle is entering into Start/Stop status, the device will report the event message STR/STP to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|2:The terminal ignores the ignition signal|

menu3.Description: After the vehicle enters into start status, if it rests again and keeps in that status for this time long, the vehicle is considered to leave start status.
If the vehicle is detected to be moving with ignition on for this time long, it is considered to be in start status
The start speed threshold to determine whether the vehicle is start or not.
After the vehicle enters into stop status and stay stop for this time long.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Minute|1: Second|
menu3.Description: It controls the time unit of <Time to Stop> and <Time to Start>.
Whether to report +RESP:GTSTP immediately when the engine is turned off.

menu2.name: Tow (Tow Alarm)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTOW command is used to configure the tow alarm parameters.

menu3.Description: A duration threshold to judge whether the moving terminal is considered being towed after its engine off.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit with engine off is in fake tow after it changes to move from stillness.
Reporting interval for sending tow alarm message.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit enters stillness status.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit enters motion status.
The threshold for on-board motion sensor to judge whether unit is moving.

menu2.name: AIS (Analog Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAIS is used to configure the parameters of analog input ports.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Alarm Within The Range|2: Enable Alarm Outside The Range|3: Connect with fuel sensor|4: No alarm mode. |5: Processed voltage mode|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the analog input alarm AIS.
This parameter indicates the lower voltage limit of the analog input port to trigger the alarm.
This parameter indicates the upper voltage limit of the analog input port to trigger the alarm.
The sampling period of the analog input port.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The device can send the analog input voltage periodically along with fixed report message. Set this field to 1 to enable it, 0 to disable.
Number of the data abandoned when calculates the fuel level
After ignition on, the fuel sensor will need delay this time long before it can report correct fuel level.

If the difference between the current fuel level after ignition on and the last measured fuel level \n before the previous ignition off is greater than this value, an unusual fuel consumption alarm \n is sent with event message +RESP:GTFLA.
This parameter defines the total number of sample readings from the fuel sensor for calculating the current fuel level.
This parameter defines the threshold of the value changed, the value changed must bigger than this threshold defined.
the offset range of Voltage
Whether the fuel level will be updated in real time.

menu2.name: DIS (Digital Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDIS is used to configure the parameters of 4 digital input ports. The input <Ignition Detection> is dedicated to ignition detection. The other three inputs are customizable. If the logic status is changed on one of the three digital input ports, the device will report the message DIS to the backend server.

menu3.Description: The time for debouncing.
The time for debouncing.
The validity time of the input port, 0 means not to check the validity time.
The time for debouncing.
The validity time of the input port, 0 means not to check the validity time.
the sampling period of the non-interruptible input port3.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Check once when the <Sample Period> condition is met.|1: Check every 2 seconds during the whole <Sample Period>.|
menu3.Description: The mode of Sample Period of the non-interruptible input port.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Include real time position in the report +RESP:GTDIS. |1: Include the last known position in the report +RESP:GTDIS.|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to include real time position or last known position in the report +RESP:GTDIS.

menu2.name: OUT (Digital Output Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTOUT command is used to output specified wave shape from the digital output ports. A total of four wave shapes are supported as shown below. If set to wave shape 1, the device will maintain this wave shape at the specified output port after power reset.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable status.|1: Enable status|2: Enable GDO status|
0: Disable status|1: Enable status|2: Enable GDO status|
0: Disable status|1: Enable status|2: Enable GDO status|
For output 1 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For output 2 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For output 3 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|
menu3.Description: Output status change with wave shape 1, whether or not report +RESP: GTDOS.
The long operation time for output2
The long operation time for output3

menu3.RangeMx: Wave5|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved For Extend|
menu3.Description: A mask bit is used to indicate which waveforms need to be monitored specifically, when this waveform occurs, +RESP:GTDOM is reported.

menu2.name: EPS (External Power Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEPS is used to configure the parameters for external power supply monitoring. The device will measure and monitor the voltage of the external power supply. If the voltage of the external power supply meets the predefined alarm condition, the device will report an alarm message EPS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1:Report when the input voltage in the range|2:Report when the input voltage outside the range|3:Report when the input voltage inside or outside the range|4:Report when the input voltage is higher than the <Max Threshold>|5:Report when the input voltage is lower than the <Min Threshold>|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the external power supply monitoring function.
The lower voltage limit of the external power supply to trigger the alarm.
The upper voltage limit of the external power supply to trigger the alarm.
The sampling period to measure the external power supply.
The time for debouncing external power voltage to avoid false report caused by excessive voltage drop in a short period of time.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not report external power supply voltage|1: Report external power supply voltage|

menu3.Description: This parameter will be used together with <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters.
This parameter is used together with <Debounce Time>.
The validity time of detecting the device connecting or disconnecting main power supply, 0 means not to check the validity time.

menu2.name: GDO (Gradual Digital Output)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTGDO command is used to configure specified gradual progressive wave shape from the digital output ports.

menu2.name: IOB (Input/Output Binding)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure the user defined output-port actions triggered by input ports. If the I/O binding is configured and the corresponding condition is met, the device will output specified wave shape on the specified output port.

menu3.Description: The ID of the user defined IO binding.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|Digital input 3|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|EIO100 input 9|EIO100 input A|EIO100 input B|EIO100 input C|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask for input ports composition. Each bit represents one digital input port. Set it to 1 to enable corresponding input port and set it to 0 to disable.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|Digital input 3|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|EIO100 input 9|EIO100 input A|EIO100 input B|EIO100 input C|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask for trigger condition composition of the corresponding input ports. Each bit represents the logic state of the corresponding input port to trigger the IOB event. Set it to 1 to use “Enable state” as the trigger condition and 0 to use “Disable state” as the trigger condition. Only when the logic state of all the input ports in one IO binding meets the trigger condition will the IOB event be triggered.
The sample period to check status of all combined digital input ports within one IO binding.

menu2.name: ROS (Restrict Output Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTROS is used to restrict the OUTPUT when the corresponding event is triggered.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit 0: Over Speed.|Bit 1: Ignition Off.
menu3.Description: A mask bit is used to indicate additional events for the output.
If the current speed is less than or equal to this value, activate output.
The debounce count for get GNSS Speed.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not check ignition state.|1:Check ignition state first.|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to check ignition state before activating output.

menu2.name: AUS (AU100 Settings)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAUS is used to configure the parameters of AU100 devices.

menu3.Description: Port ID of the AU100 device.
Port type. It cannot be set.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable port.|4:Digital fuel sensor|5:1-wire devices|12: CANBUS device|

menu3.groupname: 12: Used for CANBUS device connected to a vehicle

menu2.name: URT (Serial Port Setting)
menu2.Description2: The serial port of the device is used to connect with external devices to extend the application of the device. The command AT+GTURT is used to configure the working mode of the serial port for different external devices and the parameters for the serial port communication.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: DAT Mode|3: RFID Card|4: Digital fuel sensor.|5: AC100 devices|6: DTT With Terminator.|7: DTT ASCII Format.|8:DTT HEX Format|9:Camera.|12: CANBUS.|14: Transferring specified reports via satellite terminal.|17:EIO100 device|18: AU100 device|20:NMEA sentences.|22: WRT100 accessory.|28: Communication with TPT2.|34: AVL Reader tunneling mode.|35: Used for self-selected equipment to transfer data directly.|
7:7bits data|8:8bits data
1:1 Stop bit|2:2 Stop bits|3:1.5 Stop bits
0: None parity|1: Odd parity|2: Even parity|

0: Disable the device sleep mode and enable auto online mode.|1: Enable the device sleep mode and enable auto online mode.|2: Disable the device sleep mode and disable auto online mode.|3: Enable the device sleep mode and disable auto online mode.|

0: Reserved.|1: Reserved.|2: MR2. 9600 baud rate, 8 data bits, 1 stop bit, and no parity.|3: VD RFID. 9600 baud rate, 8 data bits, 1 stop bit, and no parity.|4: DR100. 19200 baud rate, 8 data bits, 1 stop bit, and no parity.|5: Reserved.|
menu3.Description: The type of RFID connected with serial port.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EPSILON ES2 or ES4|1: LLS 20160|2: DUT-E|3: QFS100|4: UFSxxx|5: Reserved|6: DUT-E SUM|7: Reserved|8: Escort Fuel|
0: Short format|1: Long format|

menu3.Description: When the secondary serial port receives this character, data in front of.
no data is received for a period of time longer than<Interval>, the data in UART buffer will be sent.
The maximum length of data in the message +RESP:GTDTT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Terminal does not check SACK.|1: The terminal will check the SACK and if it fails, it will resend the message up to three times.

menu3.Description: The bitwise mask to configure whether to output the specific NMEA sentence.

menu2.name: CDA (Configuration of DR100 Accessory)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCDA is used for setting DR100 accessory.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Output card ID directly And Not check.|1: Output card memory data directly And Not Check.|2: Output card ID directly And check.|3: Output card memory data directly And Check.|
menu3.Description: It configures the mode of DR100 reading card data.
It specifies which block of DR100 memory will be used to save the card key.
It is used as card key for checking with.
It specifies the number of prefix string groups.

menu2.name: CMS (Camera Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCMS command is used for setting camera parameters.

menu3.Description: Take picture numbers in one continuous shooting.
The interval between two pictures in one continuous shooting.
The compression ratio of picture. Pictures’ quality would be better with smaller compression ratio.
The resolution of picture.
The input ID used for trigger photographing.

menu3.RangeMx: Camera ID|Photo Time|
0: Backend Server|1: FTP Server|
0: ASCII|1:HEX|

menu2.name: TAP (Take-Picture)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTAP command is used for real-time photographing.

menu2.name: DAT (Transparent Data)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDAT is used to transfer data between the backend server and the accessories connected to the second serial port of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Short Format.|1: Send data directly to the serial port.|2: Long Format.|3: Send data directly to the serial port without CRLF.|4: Send data directly to the Bluetooth.|5: Send data directly to the Bluetooth without CRLF.|
menu3.Description: Command type to indicate the direction to transferring data.
Data to be transferred between the backend server and the equipment connected to the serial port of unit.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: Need report‘+ACK:GTDAT’or not.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: ASCII|1:HEX|
menu3.Description: When it is set to 1, <Data> will be converted to hex format before it is sent to the serial port.

menu2.name: TKS (Basic Information)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTKS command is used to query some base information like data, hour, GNSS fix, GPRS connection status and others through RS232.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Short information type.|2: Long information type.|
menu3.Description: This parameter is used to set the query type, different type will get different information.

menu2.name: EFS (External Digital Fuel Sensor)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEFS is used to configure the parameters of the external digital fuel sensor. If <Working Mode> in AT+GTURT is set to 4, the parameters of this command are used.

menu3.Description: The value get form the sensor when the fuel tank is full.
After the ignition is turned on, the fuel sensor will need to delay for the length of time specified by this parameter before it can report correct fuel level.

If the difference between the current fuel level after ignition on and the last measured fuel \nlevel before the previous ignition off is greater than this value, an unusual fuel consumption alarm \nis sent with event message +RESP:GTFLA, and 0 means to disable this function.
If enable, the device will not send command to the fuel sensor, \nand the sensor must be set as periodical data output
If ' Ex Unsolicited Enable ' is disable, the GV300 device will send READ \ncommand to the fuel sensor and read the data as this frequency.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No filter|1: 12 seconds|2: 24 seconds|3: 36 seconds|4: 60 seconds|5: 120 seconds|6: 180 seconds|7: 240 seconds|8: 480 seconds|9: 960 seconds|
menu3.Description: The filter factor of the sensor and now only QFS100 can use this factor, and for other sensors, this parameter is ignored.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disbale|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeric to indicate whether to report raw data from fuel sensor to the backend server with +RESP:GTFSD.
If <Unsolicited Enable Ex> is disabled, the device will send READ command to the fuel sensor.
The count of readings of fuel level used for fuel alarm detection after ignition on.
0 means Disable this function.

menu2.name: FSC (Fuel Sensor Calibration)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set the calibration table for fuel sensor.

menu3.Description: The ID of the calibration table

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EPSILON ES2 or ES4|1: LLS 20160|2: DUT-E|3: QFS100|4: UFSxxx|5: Reserved|6: DUT-E SUM|8: Escort Fuel|20: ADC1|21: ADC2|22: ADC3|

menu3.Description: Enable or disable this table, and if this table is disabled, the calculation of fuel level will be liner.

menu2.name: IDA (ID Authentication)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDA is used to protect against unauthorized use. This is achieved through an ID card reader for driver identification, and connecting an external relay (normally closed relay recommended) to cut off the starter or the fuel pump.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Only authorized ID cards can unlock the vehicle.|2: Any ID card can unlock the vehicle.|3: Only authorized ID cards can unlock the vehicle and will ignore the <Timeout after Ignition Off> and <ID Validity Time>. |

menu3.Description: when the ignition off, it still be authorized for a little time. In this period, you don’t need the authentication.

menu3.RangeMx: Report the ID which is authorized.|Report the ID which is unauthorized.|Report the ID which has logged out.|

menu3.Description: Specify the ID of the output port to output specified wave shape when it is authorized.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Report the latest RFID number Immediately|1: Report the latest RFID number Under Ignition On and Authorization,or the ignition is turned off and the timeout period specified by <Timeout after Ignition Off> is not reached.|
menu3.Description: The mode of reporting the RFID number in HEX format +RSP and +EVT messages.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: IDA Number List|1: MAC List|2: Use <IDA Number List> in the command AT+GTIDS.|
menu3.Description: This parameter indicates which ID List to use.

menu2.name: IDS (ID Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDS is used to set ID Numbers for driver authentication.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete ID Number.|1: Append ID Number.

menu2.name: UDT (User-defined Data Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUDT is used to transfer data to the serial port. Data to the serial port is wrapped into the message +RESP:GTUDT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the data transfer.|1: Enable the data transfer.|
for activated GEO|for activated PEO|

Protocol Version, Firmware Version|Hardware Version|Unique ID|Device Name|Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells，Position Append Mask|Mileage|HMC|GSV, External GNSS Antenna|GEO State|Analog Input|Digital Input, Motion Status|External Power VCC, Backup Battery Level, Charging|GEO Status Mask|PEO State|PEO Status Mask|Reserved|Send Time|

menu2.name: UFS (UFSxxx FOTA Upgrade)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUFS is used to upgrade the firmware in UFSxxx fuel sensor over the air.

menu3.Description: Specifies the maximum time of retrying to download the update package upon downloading failure.
Specifies the expiration timeout of one single downloading.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
menu3.Description: The protocol used to download the package.
Specifies the URL to download the package.

menu2.name: WRT (RF433 Accessory)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTWRT is used to configure the parameters for RF433 accessories.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Wireless temperature sensor (WTS100)|1: Wireless temperature & humidity sensor (WTH100)|

menu3.Description: The range is 0|3-255.
The count of accessories.
The time for pairing accessory.

menu2.name: ACD (1-Wire Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTACD is used to configure the parameters of 1-Wire devices which include iButton/DR200 and temperature sensor.

menu3.Description: Interval of search the I-button ID
Interval of read temperature sensor value.

menu2.name: IEX (Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIEX is used to configure the parameters of four EIO100 inputs. All these four inputs are customizable. If the logic status is changed on one of the EIO100 input ports, the device will report the message DIS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EIO100 Setting.|1: Bluetooth Accessory Input Setting.|
menu3.Description: It’s used to indicate which extended device the following parameters are used for.
It is used to bind the specific configuration in AT+GTBAS when the <Input Expansion Type>is set to 1.
The total number of configured EIO100 inputs.

menu2.name: OEX (Output Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTOEX command is used to output wave shape 1 on EIO100 output. To use this function, please set the <EIO100 Connection> in AT+GTACD to 1 for EIO100 device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EIO100 Setting.|1: Bluetooth Accessory Input Setting.|

menu3.Description: The total number of configured EIO100 outputs.

menu3.RangeMx: Output 9 |Output A |Output B|Output C|

menu2.name: AEX (Analog Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAEX is used to configure the parameters of External Bluetooth Analog Input accessories. All these inputs are customizable.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Bluetooth Analog Input|
0: Disable|1: Enable Analog Input Alarm Within The Range|2: Enable Analog Input Alarm Outside The Range|

menu2.name: TMP (Temperature Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a temperature-alarm range for the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal will report the event message TMP to the backend server when the temperature outside or inside the range is detected by the device.

menu3.Description: ID of the temperature alarm

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the Alarm within the temperature range|2: Enable the Alarm Outside the temperature range|3: Enable the Alarm within or outside the temperature range, But Report only once|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the temperature alarm.
ID of the temperature sensor
When the temperature sensor detects the environment temperature meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature this times.
the device will report temperature alarm every this times of temperature reading
If enable, temperature alarm can indicate the direction of temperature change.

menu3.groupname: 25 - SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status. It is used together with <SCS Action> below.
menu3.RangeMx: 0:Read self-calibration status.|1:Clear self-calibration status.|
0: Backend Server.|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: 0: Backend Server.|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|

menu3.groupname: 27 - RF433. Set the working mode for the RF433 accessories.
menu3.RangeMx: 0:Start learning mode.|1:Read the RF433 accessories which are paired.|2:Clear the current paired list of RF433 accessories.|
0: Backend Server.|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: 0: Backend Server.|2: Second Serial Port.|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|

menu3.groupname: 2F - CAN Query Mode. Query the information related to CAN and report them via +RESP:GTCIF message.
menu3.RangeMx: CAN Version Number|CAN Serial Number|CAN Car Name|CAN Car Model ID|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved For Extend|

menu3.groupname: 31 - DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports.
3A - RLY. Set the state of the WRL300
menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable relay of WRL300, switch the pin of the relay from NC to COM.|1:Enable relay of WRL300, switch the pin of the relay from NO to COM.|

menu2.name: SWL (SMS White List)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSWL is used to configure a list of authorized phone numbers which are allowed to configure the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Allow any phone number to configure the device. |1:Only phone numbers saved in the white list could configure the device. |

menu2.name: LBC (SMS Location Request)
menu2.Description2: This command can only be sent via SMS. The device will send SMS report with Google maps hyperlink and the current location to corresponding phone number or report LBC to the backend server immediately.
